document.docAuthor: Breitkreuz, Laura C. V., Ohl, Michael & Engel, Michael S.
document.docTitle: Arpactophilus pwaamei Breitkreuz, Ohl & Engel, 2016, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the New Caledonian Arpactophilus (Hymenoptera: Crabronidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the New Caledonian Arpactophilus (Hymenoptera: Crabronidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. FEMALE: Total length 3.7–4.3 mm , mean = 4.0 mm; forewing length 2.4–2.7 mm , mean = 2.6 mm .

Remarks.
Arpactophilus pwaamei
is most similar to
A. caac
as both share a comparable body form and coloration as well as surface structure of the dorsal propodeum. They can be distinguished by the prominent and deep punctures on the frons of
A. pwaamei
(
Fig. 91
) and the dorsally brown flagellum, which is completely yellow in the latter species (
Fig. 35
). The punctuation of the frons is similar to that in
A. tayo
(
Fig. 99
) and
A. arhoe
(
Fig. 29
).
Arpactophilus pwaamei
can be distinguished from
A. tayo
by its yellow coxae, and from
A. arhoe
by the lack of a bulge on the metasomal sternum II (
Fig. 92
, and as in
Fig. 1
).

Etymology. The specific epithet is taken from the name Pwaamei , one of the New Caledonian native languages. It is treated as a noun in apposition.
